title: Rapid TIPP reset for high distress
summary: Rapid DBT sequence to downshift the nervous system when emotions feel unmanageable.
steps: Temperature: splash cool water on your face or hold an ice cube for 20-30 seconds to trigger the dive reflex.
Intense exercise: 60 seconds of jumping jacks, running in place, or wall pushups to burn off adrenaline.
Paced breathing: inhale for 4 seconds, exhale for 6 seconds for 1-2 minutes.
Progressive muscle relaxation: tense and release shoulders, hands, and jaw to signal safety.
immediate_actions: If you feel unsafe, call 988 (US) or your local emergency number.
Stay where you are and focus on your breath for one minute.

title: Crisis lines (US)
summary: If you feel unsafe, reach out now. People are ready 24/7.
steps: Call or text 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline).
Text 'HELLO' to 741741 (Crisis Text Line).
If in immediate danger, dial 911.
immediate_actions: Move to a safe space and remove harmful items if possible.
Call 988 or a trusted person to stay with you.

title: 5-4-3-2-1 grounding
summary: Use the senses to anchor in the present and lower anxious arousal.
steps: Name 5 things you can see.
Name 4 things you can touch or feel.
Name 3 things you can hear.
Name 2 things you can smell.
Name 1 thing you can taste or a slow sip of water.

title: CBT thought check
summary: Gently challenge a sticky thought and find a balanced alternative.
steps: Situation: briefly note what happened.
Thought: write the tough thought in a sentence.
Emotion: name the feeling and rate intensity 0-10.
Evidence for/against: list 2-3 facts on each side.
Balanced thought: craft a kinder, truer line to hold.

title: Behavioral activation micro-task
summary: Pair mood support with a tiny, meaningful action that fits your energy.
steps: Pick a value: connection, health, learning, or calm.
Choose a 5 minute action (text a friend, stretch, tidy one surface, step outside).
Schedule it in the next hour with an optional reminder.
After doing it, note your mood shift on a 0-10 scale.

title: Motivational interviewing check-in
summary: Evoke your own reasons for change with gentle prompts.
steps: Importance: on 0-10, how important is this change? Why not a lower number?
Confidence: on 0-10, how confident are you? What bumps it up by 1 point?
Next best step: name one action within 24 hours that feels doable.

title: Crisis safety script
summary: Calm validation, immediate safety steps, and quick access to help.
steps: Validation: your safety matters; thank you for telling me.
Environment: remove items that could cause harm and stay with someone safe if you can.
Reach out: call 988 (US) or your local crisis line; text 741741; if in immediate danger call emergency services.
Ground: try one TIPP step (cool water or paced breathing) while we keep this brief.
